instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.02A after liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi Guys, have got this board with mild liquid damage.  Multiple corrosion points, mainly around charging ports.

<RESISTOR>R2890</RESISTOR> was fallen off, replaced now
<CAPACITOR>C3501</CAPACITOR> knocked off, left off as filter cap

Usb charging voltage is up, but I'm missing output from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>


<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>HPWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDA</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 20V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHRGR_R</SIGNAL> - 0.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

Seems like its failed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, what you guys think? Shall I replace and retest or is there something else to test before it?
No visible shorts or unexpected heat signatures

Thanks

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.02A after liquid damage
threads.message:
Did you check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
F7000/1 are good?

I didn't see <SIGNAL>TBA_VDDP</SIGNAL> voltage.
Be sure all R/<CAPACITOR>C7030</CAPACITOR>/40 and traces are good also.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.02A after liquid damage
threads.message:
Sorry, havent posted it as same as VDDA

Traces seems to be alright at <SIGNAL>TBA_BOOT</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>TBA_VDDP</SIGNAL> -5V
<SIGNAL>TBA_BOOT1_RC</SIGNAL> - 4.7V
<SIGNAL>TBA_BOOT2_RC</SIGNAL> - 4.7V


Fuses are fine,  though <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to ground 0.1VDc or 111Ohm
Inject at PPBUS?

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.02A after liquid damage
threads.message:
Two high ohm value for voltage injection.
Did you check reverse reading on diode mode?
Any big coil with the same reading?
If not, remove F7000/1 and see which side remains this value.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.02A after liquid damage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62959, member: 682"]
Two high ohm value for voltage injection.
[/QUOTE]

What would you say is reasonably lower resistance which can accommodate voltage injection? Under 50 Ohms?

Yes, this is reverse reading in diode mode 0.111Vdc

Other coils with same low readings are:

L7960 - 0.11Vdc
L800 - 0.06Vdc
L7900 - 0.26Vdc

L7410/20 - 0.01Vdc
L7211/21/31 - 0.006Vdc

When Fuses removed 0.05Vdc is on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> side

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.02A after liquid damage
threads.message:
"Yes, this is reverse reading in diode mode 0.111Vdc"
I just asked about second reading, reversing probes...

Now check resistance between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and L7960.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 20V 0.02A after liquid damage
threads.message:
Apologies, I thought you meant reverse being black probe to ground.


0.04Vdc - Red on G3H - Black to Ground
0.08 - 0.1Vdc - Black on G3H - Red to Ground

G3H to L7960 short 0.5 Ohm
